text: Hello world!
author: A programmer

text: The mystery of life isn't a problem to solve, but a reality to experience.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Deep in the human unconscious is a pervasive need for a logical universe that makes sense. But the real universe is always one step beyond logic.
author: Frank Herbert

text: What do you despise? By this are you truly known.
author: Frank Herbert

text: When religion and politics travel in the same cart, the riders believe nothing can stand in their way. Their movements become headlong - faster and faster and faster. They put aside all thoughts of obstacles and forget the precipice does not show itself to the man in a blind rush until it's too late.
author: Frank Herbert

text: It is so shocking to find out how many people do not believe that they can learn, and how many more believe learning to be difficult.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Hope clouds observation.
author: Frank Herbert

text: The mind commands the body and it obeys. The mind orders itself and meets resistance.
author: Frank Herbert

text: It is impossible to live in the past, difficult to live in the present and a waste to live in the future.
author: Frank Herbert

text: He who controls the spice controls the universe.
author: Frank Herbert

text: A process cannot be understood by stopping it. Understanding must move with the flow of the process, must join it and flow with it.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Once men turned their thinking over to machines in the hope that this would set them free. But that only permitted other men with machines to enslave them.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Any road followed precisely to its end leads precisely nowhere. Climb the mountain just a little bit to test that it's a mountain. From the top of the mountain, you cannot see the mountain.
author: Frank Herbert

text: The concept of progress acts as a protective mechanism to shield us from the terrors of the future.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Thou shalt not make a machine in the likeness of a human mind.
author: Frank Herbert

text: What senses do we lack that we cannot see or hear another world all around us?
author: Frank Herbert

text: The test of a man isn’t what you think he’ll do. It’s what he actually does.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Science is made up of so many things that appear obvious after they are explained.
author: Frank Herbert

text: I must not fear.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Fear is the mind-killer.
author: Frank Herbert

text: Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration
author: Frank Herbert

text: Dawn is brief and the day full often belies its promise.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Remember who and what thou art.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: He that sows lies in the end shall not lack of a harvest.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Time flows ever, from the first note to the last chord.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: We are not bound for ever to the circles of the world, and beyond them is more than memory.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The years will bring what they will.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Not all tears are an evil.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It must often be so, when things are in danger: some one has to give them up, lose them, so that others may keep them.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All's well as ends Better!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is useless to meet revenge with revenge: it will heal nothing.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Don't let your heads get too big for your hats.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Use well the days.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Never is too long a word.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Wonder makes the words of praise louder.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Many like to know beforehand what is to be set on the table; but those who labour to prepare the feast like to keep their secret.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Do not scorn pity that is the gift of a gentle heart.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Those who have not swords can still die upon them.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It needs but one foe to breed a war, not two.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Pain and delight flow together and tears are the very wine of blessedness.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It's no good worrying about tomorrow. It probably won't come.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is not our part to master all the tides of the world, but to do what is in us for the succour of those years wherein we are set.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Oft hope is born, when all is forlorn.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Follow what may, great deeds are not lessened in worth.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Deep in the hearts of all lies the sea-longing, which it is perilous to stir.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is best to love first what you are fitted to love.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It's not always a misfortune being overlooked.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Hope oft deceives... yet twice blessed is help unlooked for.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Good will should not be denied.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Too late is worse than never.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: In the morning counsels are best, and night changes many thoughts.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: For your own good do all that you may.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Do not spoil the wonder with haste.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are unpraised.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Ifs are vain.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I don't believe in absolute evil but I believe in absolute good.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: At the table small men may do the greater deeds.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: No need to brood on what tomorrow may bring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Generous deed should not be checked by cold counsel.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Be not unjust in your grief.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Don't take names to yourself whether they are true or false.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Where there's life there's hope... and need of vittles.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The Sun will soon rise above the shadow.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Aurë entuluva! Day shall come again!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The praise of the praiseworthy is above all rewards.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It seems less evil to counsel another man to break troth than to do so oneself.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Handsome is as handsome does.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Better mistrust undeserved than rash words.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: In the end the Shadow is only a small and passing thing: there is light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory; I love only that which they defend.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: What comes after must come.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Men can only come to morning through the shadows.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The burned hand teaches best. After that advice about fire goes to the heart.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Things will go as they will; and there is no need to hurry to meet them.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Strange are the turns of fortune!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The treacherous are ever distrustful.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Often does hatred hurt itself.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: One who cannot cast away a treasure at need is in fetters.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The world changes, and all that once was strong now proves unsure.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Oft the unbidden guest proves the best company.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The wise speak only of what they know.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: In doubt a man of worth will trust to his own wisdom.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Few can foresee whither their road will lead them, till they come to its end.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: If we stayed at home and did nothing, doom would find us anyway, sooner or later.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is easier to shout 'stop!' than to do it.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: For not we but those who come after will make the legends of our time.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Memory is not what the heart desires.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Time does not tarry ever, but change and growth is not in all things and places alike.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Maybe the paths that we each shall tread are already laid before our feet, though we do not see them.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places, but still there is much that is fair.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Live and learn.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: One must tread the path that need chooses.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Sworn word may strengthen quaking heart. Or break it.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Let him not vow to walk in the dark, who has not seen the nightfall.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It is wisdom to recognise necessity.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Oft in lies truth is hidden.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Such is oft the course of deeds that move the wheels of the world: small hands do them because they must, while the eyes of the great are elsewhere.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All that is gold does not glitter.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All that is gold does not glitter. Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Advice is a dangerous gift, even from the wise to the wise, and all courses may run ill.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Seldom give unguarded advice.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The wide world is all about you: you can fence yourselves in, but you cannot forever fence it out.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: You step into the Road, and if you don't keep your feet, there is no knowing where you might be swept off to.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The Road goes ever on and on.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Expect me when you see me.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: While there's life there's hope.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Great as your affairs may seem to you, they are only a small strand in the great web.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Most men teach, and few men learn.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Let the unseen days be. Today is more than enough.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Help oft shall come from the hands of the weak when the Wise falter.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Go whither love leads you.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Love not too well the work of thy hands and the devices of thy heart.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Still round the corner there may wait, a new road or a secret gate.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Moonlight drowns out all but the brightest stars.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I will not walk backward in life.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: For still there are so many things that I have never seen: in every wood in every spring there is a different green.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: But in the end, it's only a passing thing... this shadow. Even darkness must pass.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I was talking aloud to myself. A habit of the old: they choose the wisest person present to speak to.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: You may know, or guess, what kind of a tale it is, happy-ending or sad-ending, but the people in it don't know. And you don't want them to.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: His grief he will not forget; but it will not darken his heart, it will teach him wisdom.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Give with a free hand, but give of your own.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Fear both the heat and the cold of your heart, and try to have patience, if you can.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It may be the part of a friend to rebuke a friend's folly.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: There is no real going back.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: And Morgoth came.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: 'The Eagles! The Eagles!' he shouted. 'The Eagles are coming!'
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Never laugh at live dragons.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Aiya Eärendil Elenion Ancalima!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Elen síla lúmenn' omentielvo!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Namárië! Nai hiruvalyë Valimar. Nai elyë hiruva. Namárië!
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
